intro: Meniscium villosum, commonly known as the hairy meniscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Meniscium villosum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
